page.title: 15Richmond Park 4. Ponds
page.content: Pen Ponds are artificial and were made from a stream which flowed through the Park. The Ranger was allowed to dig and sell gravel in the seventeenth century. There is a bird sanctuary at the Upper Pond where mallard, tufted duck, coot, moorhen, grebe and swans can be seen. Pike and roach live in the ponds. Beverley Brook flows north- wards through the Park towards the River Thames, with willow trees on either bank. Many aircraft fly over on their flight- path to London Heathrow Airport. The Park is used by golfers, walkers, horse riders, joggers, dog- walkers, cyclists (there is a cycle path), model aircraft enthusiasts, kite flyers, bird watchers, polo-players, rugby players, fishermen with permits and picnickers. (see previous pages)
